intro: Tournefortia bojeri, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Tournefortia bojeri is also valued for its ability to withstand drought conditions.
